entity: The Lady in Number 6: Music Saved My Life
To Angela Lansbury, an entertainment icon who has created some of cinema's most memorable characters, inspiring generations of actors.
To Steve Martin in recognition of his extraordinary talents and the unique inspiration he has brought to the art of motion pictures.
To Piero Tosi, a visionary whose incomparable costume designs shaped timeless, living art in motion pictures.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Academy Award of Merit)
entity: To all those who built and operated film laboratories, for over a century of service to the motion picture industry.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
entity: To OFER ALON for the design and implementation of the ZBrush software tool for multi-resolution sculpting of digital models.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
entity: To ERIC VEACH for his foundational research on efficient Monte Carlo path tracing for image synthesis.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
entity: To ANDRE GAUTHIER, BENOIT SEVIGNY, YVES BOUDREAULT and ROBERT LANCIAULT for the design and implementation of the FiLMBOX software application.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Scientific and Engineering Award)
entity: To EMMANUEL PRÉVINAIRE, JAN SPERLING, ETIENNE BRANDT and TONY POSTIAU for their development of the Flying-Cam SARAH 3.0 system.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To OLIVIER MAURY, IAN SACHS and DAN PIPONI for the creation of the ILM Plume system that simulates and renders fire, smoke and explosions for motion picture visual effects.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To RONALD D. HENDERSON for the development of the FLUX gas simulation system.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To ANDREW CAMENISCH, DAVID CARDWELL and TIBOR MADJAR for the concept and design, and to CSABA KOHEGYI and IMRE MAJOR for the implementation of the Mudbox software.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To MARTIN HILL, JON ALLITT and NICK McKENZIE for the creation of the spherical harmonics-based efficient lighting system at Weta Digital.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To FLORIAN KAINZ, JEFFERY YOST, PHILIP HUBBARD and JIM HOURIHAN for the architecture and development of the Zeno application framework.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To PETER HUANG and CHRIS PERRY for their architectural contributions to, and to HANS RIJPKEMA and JOE MANCEWICZ for the core engineering of, the Voodoo application framework.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To MATT PHARR, GREG HUMPHREYS and PAT HANRAHAN for their formalization and reference implementation of the concepts behind physically based rendering, as shared in their book "Physically Based Rendering."

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To DR. PETER HILLMAN for the long-term development and continued advancement of innovative, robust and complete toolsets for deep compositing.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To COLIN DONCASTER, JOHANNES SAAM, AREITO ECHEVARRIA, JANNE KONTKANEN and CHRIS COOPER for the development, prototyping and promotion of technologies and workflows for deep compositing.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To THOMAS LOKOVIC and ERIC VEACH for their influential research and publication of the fundamental concepts of deep shadowing technology.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To GIFFORD HOOPER and PHILIP GEORGE of HoverCam for the continuing development of the Helicam miniature helicopter camera system.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To JOHN FRAZIER, CHUCK GASPAR and CLAY PINNEY for the design and development of the Pneumatic Car Flipper.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To JOSHUA PINES, DAVID REISNER, LOU LEVINSON, CURTIS CLARK, ASC, and DAVID REGISTER for the development of the American Society of Cinematographers Color Decision List technology.

category: SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL AWARD (Technical Achievement Award)
entity: To JEREMY SELAN for the development of the OpenColorIO color management framework.

category: JOHN A. BONNER MEDAL OF COMMENDATION
entity: To Charles "Tad" Marburg in appreciation for outstanding service and dedication in upholding the high standards of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
